# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem. The function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` with the year-month value in string format.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function uses the `map` function from the `DataFrames` package to apply a function to each element in the `dt` column of the DataFrame. The function applied is `Dates.format`, which converts a DateTime object into a string in the specified format.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime("2021-01-01"), DateTime("2022-02-02")])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame with values "202101", "202202".
